Package com.facebook.concurrency

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CallableSnapshotFunction<I,O,E extends Exception>
    This is very similar to a factory, but the apply() function implementations usually create a Callable which is then executed.
    Completable
    implementations may vary wildly, but typically this is for an object that wants to do any cleanup or bookkeeping when it's finished
    ConcurrentCache<K,V,E extends Exception>
    Subset of Map relevant to doing caching.
    EvictionListener<K,V>  
    ExecutorServiceFactory<T extends ExecutorService>  
    Reapable<E extends Exception>  
    TrackedCallable<V>  
    TrackedRunnable  
    ValueFactory<I,O,E extends Exception>  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CallableSnapshot<V,E extends Exception>  
    CallableSnapshotFunctionImpl<I,O,E extends Exception>  
    CastingExceptionHandler<T extends Exception>
    Performs a blind cast from an exception of type S to an exception of type T.
    CastOrWrapExceptionHandler<T extends Exception>
    Performs a safecast from an exception of type S to an exception of type T if possible.
    ConcurrencyUtil
    This is a helper class for running tasks in parallel.
    CoreConcurrentCache<K,V,E extends Exception>  
    CountTask  
    CriticalSectionFactory  
    ErrorLoggingRunnable  
    ExecutorServiceFront
    This class puts its own Queue in front of another ExecutorService.
    ExecutorServiceFrontBuilder  
    ExpiringConcurrentCache<K,V,E extends Exception>  
    FixedValueCallable<V>  
    FutureHelper<T,E extends Exception>
    helper class that decorates FutureTask.get(): 1.
    LatchTask  
    NamedDaemonThreadFactory
    A thread factory that marks all threads that it creates as daemon threads.
    NamedThreadFactory  
    NoOp  
    NullExceptionHandler<T extends Exception>
    translates any exception to 'null'.
    ParallelRunner
    Utility class in order to execute tasks in parallel on top of an executor, but bound the number of concurrent tasks used in that executor.
    RuntimeExceptionHandler
    map any exception to a runtime exception
    SingletonExecutorServiceFactory<T extends ExecutorService>  
    TaskGroup
    Provides a grouping of tasks so that when executed, the caller will have a latch to wait on to indicate when all registered tasks have completed.
    TaskGroup.FinishLatch  
    UnstoppableExecutorService
    the idea here is that we want to shield an ExecutorService from any call that might shut it down, while preserving the semantics that any user of this object can still shut it down, await termination, etc from its perspective Think of it as a localized view of another executor
    UnstoppableExecutorServiceFront
    combines the functionality of an ExecutorServiceFront and UnstoppableExecutorService.
    UnstoppableScheduledExecutorService
    same as UnstoppableExecutorService but for ScheduledExecutorService
    WrappedFuture<V>  
    WrappedScheduledFuture<V>
